result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Ratajczyk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua Ratajczyk not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Joshua Ratajczyk.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Court sets this for Final Pretrial and Jury trial dates. Court sets the deadline of 12/2/2022 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms. Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing. Matter adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Joshua Ratajczyk. Defendant Joshua Ratajczyk appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Annie Louk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery from the State. TAD evaluation will be scheduled to determine if Defendant qualifies for drug treatment Court.  Defense requests adjourned Scheduling Conference be set.  Case adjourned to Br. 9 for
adjourned scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Joshua Ratajczyk not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Pretrial conference. Defendant has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Discovery received on 8/10/2022 and Defense requests additional time to review.  Court orders the State to turnover all discovery except Crime Lab Reports within 5 days.  Case adjourned to Br 9 for an Adjourned Scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Joshua Ratajczyk not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 07/08/2022 as the deadline for the State to provide all discovery with the exception of crime lab reports to the defense. Court sets 08/08/2022 as the deadline for filing any motions or change of plea forms.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse. Case is adjourned.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Joshua Ratajczyk in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Joshua Ratajczyk in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Tomasino. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua Ratajczyk in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Joshua Ratajczyk in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
